summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an unnamed recipient to appear before the grand jury on August 16, 2019, and to produce materials related to Jeffrey Epstein and the recipient's location and activities on August 9-10, 2019. The subpoena is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: He is the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands the production of all materials relating to him, indicating he is the central subject of the grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena as part of a grand jury investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The unnamed subpoena recipient is commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and give evidence regarding alleged violations of federal law.

events.title: Time Period Under Scrutiny
events.description: The subpoena demands all materials establishing the recipient's location and activities from 4 p.m. on August 9, 2019, to 12 p.m. on August 10, 2019.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an active grand jury investigation into Jeffrey Epstein as of August 2019, focusing on alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371, 1001, and 1519 (conspiracy, false statements, and destruction of evidence).
The subpoena demands all materials related to Jeffrey Epstein from the recipient, indicating a broad evidence-gathering effort.
It specifically demands evidence of the recipient's location and activities for a critical 20-hour period: from 4 p.m. on August 9, 2019, to 12 p.m. on August 10, 2019.
The recipient of the subpoena is not named in the provided text, indicating it is a redacted or separate attachment.
The document is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman, showing high-level DOJ involvement in the Epstein investigation at that time.
